parameters.content:
## New Time Entry
**Double click** to edit me. [Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/sticky-notes/)

parameters.query:
WITH 
  project_det AS (
    SELECT * 
    FROM input2
  ),
  project_ref AS (
    SELECT *
    FROM input1
  )
SELECT
  project_ref.*,
  project_det.*

FROM 
  project_ref
LEFT JOIN 
  project_det 
ON 
  cast(project_det.id as TEXT) = cast(project_ref.sf698fb364 as text);

WITH 
  time_entry  AS
  (
  select * from input2
  )
  ,project as 
  (
  select * from input3
  )
  ,client AS
  (
  select * from input1
  )
select 
  project.sm_id as project_sm_rec_id,
  project.name as proj_name,
  client.record_id as client_sm_rec_id,
  client.id as client_id,
  client.name as client_name,
  time_entry.id as time_entry_id,
  time_entry.*
from time_entry
  left join project on project.id = time_entry.project_id
  left join client on client.id = project.client_id

SELECT * 
FROM input2
LEFT JOIN input1 
  ON trim(input1.sac94990b3) <> trim(input2.id)

parameters.content:
## Save the data
Using the switch node we work out what to do based on the previous status,  If it is the same we do nothing, If it is different we update the file in Github and if it is new we create a new file. After this is done we loop back to the Split in Batches node (OneAtAtTime) to start the process again.
